snippet: Angered by a “60 Minutes” interview downplaying Hillary Clinton’s use of a personal account, some F.B.I. officials say they saw a president trying, not for the first time, to sway an investigation.
abstract: Pres Obama says during interview on CBS television program 60 minutes that he does not believe Hillary Rodham Clinton's use of private email server while secretary of state endangered United States Security; comment angers FBI agents still investigating matter.

byline.original: By MATT APUZZO and MICHAEL S. SCHMIDT
byline.contributor: Peter Baker and Julie Hirschfeld Davis contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Angered by a “60 Minutes” interview downplaying Hillary Clinton’s use of a personal account, some F.B.I. officials say they saw a president trying, not for the first time, to sway an investigation.

headline.main: Obama’s Comments About Clinton’s Emails Rankle Some in the F.B.I.
headline.print_headline: Obama’s Comments About Clinton’s Emails Rankle Some in the F.B.I.
